question: Can doctoral students request recognition of examinations taken during previous studies?
answer_generated: Yes, doctoral students can request recognition of examinations taken during previous studies. The dean may recognize these examinations upon the student's request, provided they were successfully completed in a doctoral study programme before enrolling in the current programme. However, the request must be made within five years after the examination was passed (Article 31).
context:
Document 1: Article  31 
Recognition  of examinations  taken  during  previous  studies  in doctoral  study  programmes  
(1) The dean  may,  upon  the doctoral  student’s  request,  recognize  examinations  that the doct oral 
student  has successfully  completed  in a doctoral  study  programme  before  enrolling  in the current  
doctoral  study  programme.   Such  an examination  is considered  as if it had been  passed  on the day 
on which  it was recognized.   
 (2) Neither  a whole  study  unit nor state  doctoral  examination  may  be recognized.  
 (3) A doctoral  student  may  request  recognition  of an examination  within  five years  after  it had been  
passed.   Later  requests  will not be granted.  
 (4) The supervisor  and the relevant  Specialization  Committee  will comment  on the request.  
 (5) The dean  will take  a decision  about  the recognition  of an examination  within  30 days.
